comments.commentBody: It's nice to read, that in spite of everything else that's horrible in the world going on, that there still are wonderful people.  That's a hopeful sign, and as such you selfless nurses are helping more than just your immediate patients.  Thank you.

Krugman unfortunately lives in a time when very few point out that politics, not reasonable economic analysis, determine economic policy more than anything, and it's a great boon to the nation we have someone to point this out. As for his pieces being 'reasoned,' according to the only major study of pundits I'm aware of, he easily topped the list of whose predictions are most accurate.

His Keynesian hobbyhorse of late is well-reasoned and empirically has immense evidence to support it--1933-6, 1937, 1940-45, 54, 58...1991

Whether Larry Summers is 'left-leaning' is very much up for debate--he's the left-most of the major Rubinites, but Rubinomics is a rather (semi-discredited?) centrist or center-right (in the hands of Geithner) school. Summers did write a series of left-leaning editorials leading up to 2008, which I'm sure were partly sincere, but also seem in retrospect to have been made to defuse opposition to a nomination from left wing activists. It worked, then he pushed gently for the right while in office under Obama (a less charitable interpretation is that he was arrogant, wrong, and misinterpreted the duties of his office (his job was economics, not politics, and the US suffered because he, pressed Christie Romer heavily not to give her analysis that more extreme measures were necessary for the economy during meetings on the economic crisis at the beginning of the 1st Obama administration. Some lefty.

I sympathize. I've found it helpful to use the timer. Make sure they know that it's their responsibility to park it when the timer goes off. If it requires a verbal reminder, then they forfeit the next period.

It's easier said than done, but if you commit to the expectation that they will self-regulate per your rules, they'll get it (at least the older one). You could also treat it as a reward of sorts (get chores done first). The way I see it, this is pure recreation time, not an entitlement. Their recreation shouldn't be work or aggravation for me. If it becomes that, it's gone.

Not from their perspective. These rockets scientists of police work knew exactly what they were doing. And they are sick, sick people.

I don't think they are sick people. I think Ferguson police department was in way over its head and was doing what police departments inevitably do --close ranks. And, yes, the police departments here in these little heavily black municipalities have a bunker mentality; there's no doubt about it. All the more reason why we need a Justice Dept. investigation.

It's just a given that the police handled this whole situation about as badly as they could have. The handling of the body, laying in the street for hours. The police chief's press conference where he tells a garbled and contradictory story. The officer's failure to file an incident report. The self-serving leaks by the department about contradictory eye witness accounts, but providing no supporting details.

From here it looks like the police know how badly they've bungled this. And now they are furiously covering their behinds. Whatever the real facts are, if they are revealed in a secret grand jury process, how can the public have any faith that justice is being served? Only the sunlight that comes with a public hearing will help to heal the damage that has already been done.

Members of ISIS, Nazis, Fascists, Authoritarian Communists, and other totalitarian extremists have in common Ross the age old mortal flaw of human psychology: we're terrified of existence and death.

Some react by demanding that all others bend to their willful attempt to assert "their" order. Ku Klux Klan, Stalin, and other political extremists with Christian, Hindu, Buddhist, Muslim and other religious extremists share a sense of self righteousness that is intolerant of willful behavior of others that fails to conform to their strict definitions of human behavior. Even among themselves extremists are intolerant.

The motive isn't in philosophy, theology or political ideology but in the psychological framework on which all else human is suspended.

In our age most don't pay attention to Karl Jung, Otto Rank, Wilhelm Reich, and their peers, but all of them cited the foundations on which rest the calamities of man: terror of death, fear of life, or at least its untidy unpredictability, and obsession with controlling all by the assertion of institutions of their own making.

The fear of extremists may be what you call liberal democracy. But as assuredly there are among terrorists individuals who fear the failure of fellow terrorists to conform.

Christianity splits from early "Jewish Christianity;" Roman and Orthodox Catholics split; Reformation and War of religion. Stalin kills perceived enemies. The Prophet transits to Shia and Sunni...

All run terrified forever.

I think we are past the opportunity for negotiation to a solution. The options are becoming limited to military options only, at least until ISIS is destroyed to the point of no recovery. Make no mistake about it, this threat is as dangerous as Hitler and needs to be treated as such.

With Hitler, we tried negotiation, we tried appeasement, we tried turning our back on it all before joining in WWII. It took Pearl Harbor to drag us in. I consider the beheading of an American on global display to be no less an infamy.

With war you must sometimes have strange bedfellows to win or be killed. Assad is nobody compared to Stalin yet we found we could work with Stalin when it came to a mutual visceral threat. Its time for our President and Congress together (for once) to Declare War on ISIS, for our President to lead, our military to fight, and our people to support it through both funding and troop levels even if that takes taxes and a Draft.

Once we really have a real Mission Accomplished, like we did in Germany and in Japan, we can sort out the pieces, do a Marshall Plan, have a cold war with Assad, and rejoin our petty politics.

But for now, it's time to fight. We have been attacked as clearly as we were on 12 7 41 and 9 11 01. We need to do what we did after Pearl Harbor, not what we did after the Twin Towers. We need to win crushingly and then get out, not be distracted with personal vendettas. We have a clear & present danger. It is a monster. It needs slaying.

We absolutely do not need to escalate the situation in the Middle East. We are going to suffer economically and personally in loses of young loved needed American lives more than they will, I hope and pray I am wrong on this.
Muslims and Arabs are not stupid and they see that they are killing themselves without necessity. If they are left alone to take a time out and breath, they will reach the same state of balance they had before the Palestinian uproot. Please President, you are already on your way out, you do not need to bow anymore; get out of the Middle East. Of course you are going to be savaged by the Internet trolls, but you can take that. Just take much, very much care of not being impeached on a technicality, for not continuing this Religion War, and everything will be all right. And you will be the greatest in History.

The gibberish coming out of the talking heads on ISSA, not to mention obsessive coverage of the horrific murder of James Foley is shockingly trite and unhelpful.

To pay ransom or not to pay; to go into Syria or not to go; and to put boots on the ground or not to. And of course the mindless political chatter from the right that blames Obama for everything.

Complaints over what we have done are endless while meaningful ideas over what we should and can do are none existent. And of course the general public beyond a general disinterest goes about its shop till we drop life as usual.

The middle east is broken. ISSA or Al Qaeda or similar extremist ideology are not problems bound to nations or by borders. And in a globalized world they are not limited by geography or place. Nor are they alone in their senseless inhumanity. America, Europe, Asia, and Christianity all share recent (and ongoing) histories of doing unspeakable evil in the name of some self righteous cause (do not many Christians want to turn America into a Christian State; Does not Israelis want to protect Israel as a Jewish State). How much does it matter to the dead whether they die by knife across the neck, bullet to the head, or bomb from the sky.

Syria, Egypt, Libya, Iraq, and the rest of the Middle East have proven ungovernable except by autocratic rule and ruthless oppression. Even America has become ungovernable thanks to our own extremists on the right. Hate is now the global operative word.
